comments.commentBody: never will happen
Donald Trump's worst enemy is himself. He is fighting against his own personal failings, and bringing the country down with him.

This is just the latest example of our (unfortunately) President's paranoid, delusional thinking. This man is clearly mentally unbalanced. The American people deserve a thorough, unbiased, psychiatric examination of this man, with the results and diagnosis made public. He has shown that he is not temperamentally fit lead, and is certainly not to be trusted with America's safety and well being. And, considering the growing number of revelations regarding his ties to Russia, it is more important than ever that he provide his federal income tax returns for public scrutiny.

Strident calls for increased set-asides have become a cottage industry of those who enjoy benefits from being seen as their loudest exponents. Giuliani famously had his problems with the leaders of minority communities as mayor of NYC, not because he treated them badly (he didn’t), but because he refused to treat them differently from anyone else.

Then, the notion of racial-or-ethnicity-specific “reparations” is as impractical as getting Spain to pay for the poverty one sees in the Caribbean and in Central and South American countries for having foisted on them worthies such as Columbus, Cortés and Pizarro 500 years ago. It’s not just an “immodest proposal”, it’s simply not going to happen.

Ross’s offering probably isn’t actionable. I like eliminating racial and ethnic set-asides and replacing them with preferences based solely on socioeconomic status, but that cottage industry is very strong and the set-asides too entrenched to easily be reformed. As to the part about a one-time “reparation” to proven descendants of African slaves, America would revolt at such a suggestion when there are so many MORE non-blacks than blacks in America who live day-to-day and badly. The money would be FAR better spent in a massive effort to mainstream high-quality education in our inner cities and poorest rural areas, could be salable, and would have the effect of lifting our poorest blacks and Hispanics far more effectively and sustainably than merely handing out money to some.

These sound like good solutions, but try getting any wealthy community in ANY state or region to pay for the education of ANY poor or disadvantaged community, regardless of race, AND try getting the funding through a Congress that will use "limited government" as a justification for offering little to no help from the federal level.
Good luck with both both endeavors!

Desden:

True that it's encouraging that you agree with me two days running. If it should become three, I could indeed hold out hope for you.

Bryan:

What was most noticeable about Barack Obama is that he often spoke moderate sense, and eloquently, but rarely if ever had the leadership chops to convert his arguments into productive action: he was the least successful president in a LONG time at successfully exploiting his bully pulpit. Trump is RATHER less eloquent but may turn out to be FAR more effective at this. You CAN rally the people to broadly useful purposes with the right skills. But you need the right skills.
This went pretty fast and if I knew how to spell DAGUERREOTYPE, it may have been even faster.  I'm not much for chemistry but still felt I was in my element.

Oh. here's how Tom Lehrer learned elements:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bfrv8Y9746g

Paul, something I saw on a British late-night show while browsing the telly, from a fan of Tom Lehrer who you might recognize:
https://youtu.be/v1TfPDlA1xE

Are we not supposed to see how Trump's feeble attempt to distract attention about the illegal relationship of his administration with a foreign government brought about their stealing of the last presidential election?

I thought that in earlier times at least this was grounds for charges of treason!

I see no reason why any of of this administration should remain in power.

Let us take the bull by the horns and call for a new election! I know it's expensive but in the long run it will be more expensive not to do it.

I can't accept either Trump or Putin as my president!!!

It seems that many people have been thinking my first comment was too radical but as Trump's true mentality has manifested itself after his statement read off a teleprompter (which even impressed Van Jones!) Trump has reverted to his real unstable self and perhaps my previous ideas may seem less radical.

Jut think of Pence as the next president if Trump is impeached!

Hey NYT picks, none of your comments include the actual reason he is doing this.

He is merely offering an explanation to his supporters. As long as his support is strong among them he doesn't care what us NYT readers think. If he can convince his base that he is being persecuted he will continue to have plenty of support to carry on as he has.

Please democrats learn the lesson of what is happening here. Until we wen over some of his supporters he can do whatever he wants. We will not win them over by bashing and ignoring them. It's not about what he is doing to us. His supporters don't care about that. We must win some over by addressing their fears and concerns. Finally! please! Our narcissism must come to an end.

Wire Tapped - how old fashioned. It is now wireless tapped - or better known as Social Media "Follow".

Besides, how does he know it wasn't his buddy Putin breathing heavily and giggling on his tapped phone?

Bottom line - this old man is paranoid, running scared at all the truthful leaks that are coming out and is lashing out like any teenager with a grudge and Twitter account. Graham seems to have taken the bait to divert investigating of Russian-Trump subversion to chase fictional red herrings all over the place.

A nuclear meltdown will be nothing like a Trumpian meltdown.

I think one of Donald's own toadies is his dreaded leaker.  Heck, there may be lots of them.  He doesn't hang around with the most savory group, and few if any of these people have a long term relationship with him.  Maybe it's Conway or Spicer, or someone in a similar position.  Neither of those two can keep their mouth shut and both come across as sort of crazy.  Someone might want to stir up some action so Donald will realize how much he 'needs' them.

Trump is delusional. For the most part, he doesn't know what he is talking about.

He won the election only because the Russians didn't want Hillary Clinton as President. He is extraordinarily ill-prepared for the job.

1.Fools can vote as long as they're registered to vote.
2. Gerrymandering.
Sounds libelous to me.  A $50 Million lawsuit against Trump would force him to be accountable.  I hope Obama considers it.

So Trump lashed out at Obama without any evidence to support his claim. Clearly something was on his mind.

Hmmm.

Makes me wonder what intelligence report may have been presented to Trump in the last 24hours that may have contained sensitive and/or classified information... such as that Trump Tower phones were being tapped as part of an ongoing Justice Dept investigation... of which the FBI Director Comey would neither confirm or deny such investigation in the waning months prior to and even after the election... although we are all quite clear on what Comey thought was "necessary" to share with the American people in a timely manner just prior to the election... and elections clearly have consequences.

Hmmm.

So Trump would never "leak" classified information in a tweet would he?

Or did he?
Oh, let it be so.
Thanks, Obama..    really.    Seriously...

Please. This ridiculous bully has been pinning his misdeeds on others for a lifetime. Can't you just imagine what a lout he was in grade school? He never moved out of that phase, forever an adolescent jerk. Classic Trumpian method of operation: the closer they get to revealing the truth, the more King Don projects onto his critics. Someone in his propagandist's circle should tell him how predictable and unhinged he appears when doing so.

Special Investigator, connect the constructivist dots: Russia, Russia, Russia! Start by subpoenaing his tax returns.
I go with Brazen Con man.

He is either mentally unfit to be president, or he uses these unbelievable claims to manipulate.  Is there anything in the laws or Constitution to have him involuntarily, psychologically evaluated so that we will know how to logically proceed?

Distraction. This is not about Obama or wiretapping. It's not about Sessions (although it looks like that set off the tweeter-tantrum this morning). This is about Russia. Manafort, Gordon, Kushner, Flynn... they all got caught dealing with the Russians during the campaign. Why was Manafort fired? Why was Flynn fired. The madman is just one step closer to the cliff's edge. When he falls it will be spectacular, and it will be because he gets his intelligence reports from Not-So-Bright-Bart News, Alex Jones and Rush. To coin a phrase. Sad!
Trump is no doubt feeling the heat from a possible investigation into his dealings with Russia and is using his usual distraction ploy to move the spotlight off of himself. So sad!
Constitutional crisis in 5...4...3...2

Surprise! Another tacky move by Trump.

When its all over with, we'll have to overhaul the history books because "Silent Cal" Coolidge has dramatically jumped up the rankings of good presidencies.
Wait now -  isn't this the same Donald Trump who claimed Obama was not born in the good old USofA? Why, yes I do think this is the same fellow - case closed.

If if this allegation had been made any time other than today, I'd probably think he was paranoid.  However, after all we've recently learned about what governmental agencies are capable of doing electronically, I'm now inclined to think that they probably did, just like they have every one of us.  Talk about who the paranoid ones are.
Remember Iver, just because you are paranoid, doesn't mean they are not out to get you.

Yes, but that doesn't mean that Obama ordered his phones tapped.   Which he didn't do.   If the FBI decided that given the volume of calls between an American citizen and Russian banks and Russian entities, wiretapping was called for, that's another thing altogether.

What they're capable of and what they actually do are two different things.  And the president does not have the authority to go before the FISA court, that's only our intelligence services and the FBI.
Just because you're paranoid, doesn't mean you're not paranoid.  Or something.
Just because you are paranoid, does not mean there are not people after you.
